{"title": "Baby Sorter", "title_search": "baby sorter", "title_keyword": "baby sorter", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/baby-sorter/", "summary": "A game for early learning of your toddler (from 1.5 years old)Offering your kid to play this game will learn him many acquirements necessary for normal development. The child will learn to discern shapes, colors, textures, get acquainted with numbers and such notions as beauty, order, repairs. The game also favors the development of fine motor skills, attention, sagacity, assiduity and give a lot of fun from the first little victories.The main screen of the game displays 6 pictures. Tapping on them will bring on one of game screens:- Box with colors: for learning different colors. The child have to fill the cans with relevant colors. There are tips with color names for parents, to be said aloud when the kid is working with a certain color.- Room with a box: for learning to discern different shapes, also introduces the child to the understanding of order. The kid has to put the toys in the box at their right places.- Pyramid: for learning to differentiate the shapes by size. The kid has to build the pyramid up in correct order.- Christmas tree: for learning shapes of objects, also introduces to the conception of beauty. The kid has to decorate the Christmas tree with toys.- Numbers: helps to learn digits and count to 9. The child has to put the digits in relevant sections of the box.- Curtain: for learning geometric figures not only by shape but also by texture. The kid will be introduced to the concept of repairs. The child has to put patches onto the holes in the curtain. As much as with any other toy, at the beginning your child will need your help and attention. Do not forget to express your sincere joy at your kid’s achievements, this will give him additional motivation in his quest to explore the world.", "genre": ["Edutainment"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2011-05-10", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-190965-52.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-190965-52.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Smartphoneware (Developer)", "Smartphoneware (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Smart Girl's Playhouse Smash Hit", "title_search": "smart girls playhouse smash hit", "title_keyword": "smart girls playhouse smash hit", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/smart-girl-s-playhouse-smash-hit/", "summary": "IT'S A SMASH HIT! The nationally recognized and award winning series is now available on iTunes! Do your best to hit as many moles as you can and compete worldwide for the high score through Game Center! This developmentally appropriate game offers young girls the chance to play their favorite Smart Girls Playhouse games on the iPhone/iPod! {"title": "Bicentenario 2010: Los Heroes de Mexico", "title_search": "bicentenario 2010 los heroes de mexico", "title_keyword": "bicentenario 2010 los heroes de mexico", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/bicentenario-2010-los-heroes-de-mexico/", "summary": "¡El mejor juego para celebrar el Bicentenario! Otras batallas importantes incluyen:  El Sitio de Cuautla en 1812 La Defensa del Rio de Soto la Marina en 1817  Además al igual que en la independencia, se presentarán batallas de la revolución Mexicana las cuales podrás descargar durante el centenario de la revolución. {"title": "Pentomino Smackdown", "title_search": "pentomino smackdown", "title_keyword": "pentomino smackdown", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/pentomino-smackdown/", "summary": "Two player game of strategy and spacial relations, based on the famous Pentominoes puzzle.   Tantalizing, thought provoking adaptation of the Pentomino Challenge game created by James Follete.  Played head to head with iPad between two opponents seated across the table or side-by-side (players sit next to each other and pass iPad back and forth.)  Designed specifically for the iPad.   Object  Play more pentominoes than your opponent.  Play  Players alternately place pentominoes on the board until a player has no move left, then the other player plays until he also has no moves.  Scoring  Each piece played scores one point, highest score wins.   Rules: 1) The first piece must cover at least one of the four center squares 2) Each subsequent piece must touch a piece already on the board along at least one square's side (i.e. touching corner to corner is insufficient.) 3) Empty board spaces/holes completely enclosed by pieces and/or board edge must consist of at least 5 touching squares (and again, the sides must touch, not just the corners.)  Controls: - To select a piece to play, tap the piece in the highlighted row (this row may be along the board's top or bottom, depending on whose turn it is.) The active player's row is highlighted to look like buttons, the other player's row is a status display to show which pieces remain. - When you select a piece, it appears floating transparently over the board in the center. - To move the piece, touch it and drag. - To rotate the piece, use the two rotate buttons. - To mirror flip the piece, use the horizontal and vertical flip buttons. - To play the piece into the spot under it, tap the piece, or press the Play button. - To undo a move, press the Undo button - When you have no move, press the Pass button  Hints: - Try to create spaces on the board that match one of your remaining pieces which your opponent has already played. - To let the other player go first, use the Pass button. - To change the "floating piece" tap a different piece in the selection row - Turn head to head switch off in Menu when players are side by side", "genre": ["Board"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2010-09-29", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-167971-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-167971-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Mystic Software (Publisher)", "Mystic Software (Developer)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Glass Tower 3", "title_search": "glass tower 3", "title_keyword": "glass tower 3", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/glass-tower-3/", "summary": "A long awaited continuation of top-selling Glass Tower game!Glass Tower 2 was downloaded over 6 000 000 times and reached Top #1 all over the world!This time there's no in-app purchases, 150 LEVELS are included!Glass Tower 3 is a game with physical collisions and gravity simulation.Gameplay seems to be easy at first. The tower is constructed of blocks which are different in size, shape and color. Your aim is to break all blue blocks and to save as many red blocks as possible.Blue blocks add a score. Its amount depends on the size of the block. Red blocks subtract your score the same way.Also every broken red block subtract one "life". You have 3 lives at the beginning of each level.Due to physical-based engine every level can be over in different ways. Some blocks contain bonuses. When you break such block - the bonus takes off and rises on screen edge.You should have time to "catch" it, by taping on it by finger. Action of each bonus is explained during gameplay.Your game progress is always saved, so you can continue playing last level you reached any time.Game features highlights:- 150 levels!- retina support- relaxing ambient music for each background- real-like physical simulation- fast and powerful game engine with a lot of realtime visual effects- bright and clear graphics- very cool sounds of shattering glass- different backgrounds to choose- cool bonuses- game center", "genre": ["Puzzle"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2011-08-01", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-201111-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-201111-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["iDevUA Treelight Limited (Publisher)", "iDevUA Treelight Limited (Developer)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

Instead of moving a paddle, you draw lines on the screen to avoid the ball to scape in the bottom of screen. Balls are removed by groups of colors when ball hits them. And it brings several other amenities. the game is really challenging.  How to play:  *Draw lines on the screen with your finger to control Attack Balls.  *Destory all the balls on the game board.  *The more you break with one color, the higher the score you get.  *How to get the higher score? Every play is different.  - Challenges mode, 4 same levels, how to win a higher score, or less time through?  - 8 Leaderboards. 12 Achievements.  - 7 cards of different functions.
